job_tasks.phrase: Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms
job_tasks.justification: This involves enabling the integration of user applications/workloads into the provided AI/HPC platforms, which is a form of software integration support.

job_tasks.phrase: Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on optimizing the user's application code and performance, which falls under improving software integration and efficiency.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform.
job_tasks.justification: This involves improving the efficiency and integration of user workflows within the platform's capabilities.
Benchmarking and administration of workloads are operational tasks related to managing and monitoring the performance and usage of the platform.

soft_skills.phrase: rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person
offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.
closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners.

profile.rationale: The job description focuses on supporting researchers and students in deploying and optimizing their scientific workloads on AI/HPC platforms. Tasks include assisting with deployment, optimizing applications and workflows, benchmarking, and administration. All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically 1.A.1. Software Development & Integration and 1.A.2. Operations & MLOps (LLMOps). There are no tasks related to developing AI models, prompt engineering, or other GenAI/ML specialization activities (Macro-Category B). Therefore, the profile is Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about the responsibilities being focused on supporting users and optimizing their applications/workflows on existing platforms, rather than developing AI models or integrating AI into products. The distinction between supporting the *use* of AI/HPC platforms and building AI-powered features is clear.
